summary: Ughhhhh I love your most recent Dany gifset. Also I think Dany would be one of the last people to call herself a hero. I think...
question: Ughhhhh I love your most recent Dany gifset. Also I think Dany would be one of the last people to call herself a hero. I think she would simply say she’s doing what should be done, not anything particular heroic.
answer:
Thank you so much!! You are so sweet <3 

I completely agree, Daenerys does what she does because at her very core she wants to help people. She’s not doing it for fame (she’s adamant that the slaves must take their own freedom, that they don’t owe it to her and that she simply gave them the chance) and she’s not doing it to be worshipped (she scoffs at Viserys belief that people would flock to him because of his power and name). Daenerys grew up powerless and used for others gain. The moment she managed to attain some sort of autonomy for herself she used it to help others. And the more power she gains, the more people she’s able to help. Now, she’s powerful enough to protect Westeros against the army of the dead and so she will.

“We both want to help people. We can only help them from a position of strength.”

summary: Haters: *hate on female characters having too many skills and being too powerful and too intelligent and call them Mary...
body:
Haters: *hate on female characters having too many skills and being too powerful and too intelligent and call them Mary Sues*

Haters: *hate on female characters for having faults and making mistakes and not always knowing the right answer and call them evil villains*

Haters: *call female characters who cry “useless”*

Haters: *call female characters who express anger “evil” and “too far gone”*

Haters: *have no use for female characters who don’t fit their ideal for love interests*

Haters: *slut shame female characters who express and act on sexual desire*

Haters: *hate female characters*

summary:
Rewatching GoT has made me realize a couple of things
1. Jon Snow has always been and will always be a motherfucking SNACK.
2....
body:
Rewatching GoT has made me realize a couple of things

1. Jon Snow has always been and will always be a motherfucking SNACK.

2. Daenerys is just so freaking beautiful and strong and I would die for her.

3. The Stark children need to be protected at all costs.

4. Davos is a the true dad of Westeros. He’s Jon’s dad, he’s Gendry’s dad, he’s MY dad, he’s everyone’s dad.

5. Daenerys Targaryen has always had BDE.

6. Arya has always had BDE.

7. Gendry amd Arya had such a cute relationship and I miss them.

8. Brianne is the best of us all and I would happily let her kick my ass.

9. Joffrey is a little bitch.

10. Podrick is adorable.

11. The way Jon and Daenerys stories parallel is just amazing and just proves that they were meant to be. I also love them so much.

Anyway that’s what I got so far I’ll probably post some more later.

blog.name: fan64625
blog.title: Just sharing my thoughts and interests
blog.description: Elisa, Europe. Multifandom, new to tumblr so be gentle ;-) At the moment I'm all about Game of Thrones/Jonerys. I also love OUAT/Captain Swan, Harry Potter, and much more.

body:
The burning of the Tarlys

I know much has been written about it, but I’m doing a re-watch and have so many thoughts.

First of all, second time watching, after reading many posts and metas, I’m completely in Danys side. She really gives both Randyll and Dickon a chance. She would have spared them, would even send them to the wall. Randyll just refuses, insults her, calls her a foreign invader and calls her people savages. Any leader who wants to be taken serious in this world would have killed them. Seriously, burn that guy!

The problem in the scene is Tyrion. He is shocked and appalled and somehow that’s why I also felt bad the first time I watched it. And. It doesn. Make. Sense. I mean, what the actual fuck, Tyrion? This is your queen. Stand by her or leave. You burned men yourself, remember? Wildfire, battle of the blackwater, ring a bell? I mean, it’s not like he apologized to Sir Davos for burning his son alive. But now daenerys is using it as her weapon, they are dead in seconds, and he’s shocked??

It makes me wonder why it was written that way. I don’t believe for a millisecond in dark! Dany, so that would never be an argument for me. Is it foreboding of betrayal on Tyrions part? I really don’t know. Anybody any thoughts?

tags: i am gonna use all my old tags just to spite you dear anon
summary: OK but why do u stan a crazy pyromaniac? I'm in the deanerys tag and you ppl actually have a 'defence squad' to defend her...
question: OK but why do u stan a crazy pyromaniac? I'm in the deanerys tag and you ppl actually have a 'defence squad' to defend her burning ppl and insulting sansa. it's so obvious ur threat by her.
answer:
But-but-but— I don’t stan Aerys Targaryen?? So, I don’t know where you are coming from????


If you are asking me why I stan Daenerys Targaryen, the rightful queen of the Seven Kingdoms, why wouldn’t I stan the titular character of  A Song of Ice and Fire?

Why wouldn’t I stan the one character who is actively fighting against slavery (in a world where the final antagonists are magical slavers, aka Others)?

Why wouldn’t I stan the character who fights against rape? Why wouldn’t I stan the character who appreciates and assimilates into different cultures? Why wouldn’t I stan one of the most well-travelled, multilingual character? Why wouldn’t I stan the character who has pocs in her council?

Why wouldn’t I stan the person who listens to nobles and lowborn alike?

Why wouldn’t I stan the queen who literally forgave the person who spat in her face?

Why wouldn’t I stan the person who wishes that her betrayer gets his dearest wish - to go home?

Why wouldn’t I stan the person who does the right thing, who believes that the strong should protect the weak, even at the cost of grave danger to herself?

I think I should ask you - why wouldn’t you stan Daenerys Stormborn?

As for “burning people”, I guess Jon Snow and Tyrion Lannister are “crazy pyromaniacs” too, according to you?

Both of them have also burned people during war, Jon definitely has Targaryen blood, Tyrion might have… So are they crazy pyromaniacs too? No? Why not?

Also, I don’t know what head-canon world you live in…. But when did Dany insult Sansa? They haven’t even met yet!

The reason why “we people” have a tag called “Daenerys Defense Squad” is because there are some people with 0% reading & visual comprehension who keep on making incredibly wild accusations about Daenerys…

… Kinda like calling her “crazy pyromaniac”.


I couldn’t care less about Sansa, tbh.

(Just to be clear, this is no hate on her character, I couldn’t care less about Davos either. Davos is a good guy, but I don’t give a fuck about him either.)

You thinking I’m threatened by Sansa is… quite hilarious to me!

I, and most of the Daenerys fans, aren’t the ones writing meta after meta about “how Sansa is the evilest evil and Jon Snow is deceiving her”. It is quite the reverse.

We are not the ones filling the character’s tag with hate.

You literally just confessed that “I’m in the deanerys tag” (its daenerys, btw), found my blog through that tag, then found my blog (wherein the description clearly states I am a fan of Dany), and then proceeded to send me an anon message calling Dany “a crazy pyromaniac” and accusing me of “being threatened”. 

Do you have an ounce of self-awareness?

Dear anon, I am not the one browsing the tag of a character I hate and finding blogs to send anon messages to. That’s you. I’m not the one writing hate and calling heroic characters as “crazy pyromaniacs”. That’s you. So, let’s be very clear I’m not the one feeling threatened by the female protagonist of a series. That’s you.

Why wouldn’t I stan the queen who literally forgave the person who spat in her face?

Why wouldn’t I stan the person who wishes that her betrayer gets his dearest wish - to go home?

Why wouldn’t I stan the person who does the right thing, who believes that the strong should protect the weak, even at the cost of grave danger to herself?

I think I should ask you - why wouldn’t you stan Daenerys Stormborn?

As for “burning people”, I guess Jon Snow and Tyrion Lannister are “crazy pyromaniacs” too, according to you?

Both of them have also burned people during war, Jon definitely has Targaryen blood, Tyrion might have… So are they crazy pyromaniacs too? No? Why not?

Also, I don’t know what head-canon world you live in…. But when did Dany insult Sansa? They haven’t even met yet!

The reason why “we people” have a tag called “Daenerys Defense Squad” is because there are some people with 0% reading & visual comprehension who keep on making incredibly wild accusations about Daenerys…

… Kinda like calling her “crazy pyromaniac”.


I couldn’t care less about Sansa, tbh.

(Just to be clear, this is no hate on her character, I couldn’t care less about Davos either. Davos is a good guy, but I don’t give a fuck about him either.)

You thinking I’m threatened by Sansa is… quite hilarious to me!

I, and most of the Daenerys fans, aren’t the ones writing meta after meta about “how Sansa is the evilest evil and Jon Snow is deceiving her”. It is quite the reverse.

We are not the ones filling the character’s tag with hate.

You literally just confessed that “I’m in the deanerys tag” (its daenerys, btw), found my blog through that tag, then found my blog (wherein the description clearly states I am a fan of Dany), and then proceeded to send me an anon message calling Dany “a crazy pyromaniac” and accusing me of “being threatened”. 

Do you have an ounce of self-awareness?

Dear anon, I am not the one browsing the tag of a character I hate and finding blogs to send anon messages to. That’s you. I’m not the one writing hate and calling heroic characters as “crazy pyromaniacs”. That’s you. So, let’s be very clear I’m not the one feeling threatened by the female protagonist of a series. That’s you.
trail.content:
But-but-but— I don’t stan Aerys Targaryen?? So, I don’t know where you are coming from????


If you are asking me why I stan Daenerys Targaryen, the rightful queen of the Seven Kingdoms, why wouldn’t I stan the titular character of  A Song of Ice and Fire?

Why wouldn’t I stan the one character who is actively fighting against slavery (in a world where the final antagonists are magical slavers, aka Others)?

Why wouldn’t I stan the character who fights against rape? Why wouldn’t I stan the character who appreciates and assimilates into different cultures? Why wouldn’t I stan one of the most well-travelled, multilingual character? Why wouldn’t I stan the character who has pocs in her council?

Why wouldn’t I stan the person who listens to nobles and lowborn alike?

Why wouldn’t I stan the queen who literally forgave the person who spat in her face?

Why wouldn’t I stan the person who wishes that her betrayer gets his dearest wish - to go home?

Why wouldn’t I stan the person who does the right thing, who believes that the strong should protect the weak, even at the cost of grave danger to herself?

I think I should ask you - why wouldn’t you stan Daenerys Stormborn?

As for “burning people”, I guess Jon Snow and Tyrion Lannister are “crazy pyromaniacs” too, according to you?

Both of them have also burned people during war, Jon definitely has Targaryen blood, Tyrion might have… So are they crazy pyromaniacs too? No? Why not?

Also, I don’t know what head-canon world you live in…. But when did Dany insult Sansa? They haven’t even met yet!

The reason why “we people” have a tag called “Daenerys Defense Squad” is because there are some people with 0% reading & visual comprehension who keep on making incredibly wild accusations about Daenerys…

… Kinda like calling her “crazy pyromaniac”.


I couldn’t care less about Sansa, tbh.

(Just to be clear, this is no hate on her character, I couldn’t care less about Davos either. Davos is a good guy, but I don’t give a fuck about him either.)

You thinking I’m threatened by Sansa is… quite hilarious to me!

I, and most of the Daenerys fans, aren’t the ones writing meta after meta about “how Sansa is the evilest evil and Jon Snow is deceiving her”. It is quite the reverse.

We are not the ones filling the character’s tag with hate.

You literally just confessed that “I’m in the deanerys tag” (its daenerys, btw), found my blog through that tag, then found my blog (wherein the description clearly states I am a fan of Dany), and then proceeded to send me an anon message calling Dany “a crazy pyromaniac” and accusing me of “being threatened”. 

Do you have an ounce of self-awareness?

Dear anon, I am not the one browsing the tag of a character I hate and finding blogs to send anon messages to. That’s you. I’m not the one writing hate and calling heroic characters as “crazy pyromaniacs”. That’s you. So, let’s be very clear I’m not the one feeling threatened by the female protagonist of a series. That’s you.

blog.description: Hey there, my name is Andromeda Auburn. I'm not a writer, or a film critic, or the most interesting person in the world. Mainly I sit at home and watch TV. I figured that if I am going to be sitting here doing nothing I might as well be doing something slightly productive. From here on I am going to try and write my thoughts on the show(s) I am currently watching. So !!SPOILER!! Hope you enjoy my mindless rambling and keep reading.

summary: What do you think is going to happen to the Dany/Dothraki/Vaes Dothrak story? She has Drogon besides her, so it feels to me that...
question: What do you think is going to happen to the Dany/Dothraki/Vaes Dothrak story? She has Drogon besides her, so it feels to me that recruiting the Dothraki and being proclaimed Stallion that Mounts the World is going to be simply too easy.
answer:
I have the distinct feeling that easy is going to be the point of Dany’s storyline in TWoW. With a dragon under her control, it’s easy to terrify people. It’s easy to burn things down. It’s easy to offer the Dothraki the glory and conquest they want, and easy to burn the slavers so that it works out.

The conflict I think Dany will face, in other words, is internal rather than external. Easy victories are going to hand her some hard, soul-searching questions.
